com.ihealth.communication.control

Class Am3sControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ihealth.communication.control.Am3sControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DeviceControl

    public class Am3sControl
extends java.lang.Object
    Public API for the AM3S

    The class provides methods to control AM3S device. You need to call the device method, and then call the connection method

    If you want to connect a AM3S device, you need to calliHealthDevicesManager.startDiscovery(long) to discovery a new AM3S device, and then calliHealthDevicesManager.connectDevice(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)to connect AM3S device.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteAlarmClock(int id)
      Delete alarm by id This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately. If delete successfully, following callback will be triggered:
      iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
      The action is AmProfile.ACTION_DELETE_ALARM_SUCCESS_AM. The message will be null. If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
      iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
      The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
      the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
      void destroy() 
      void disconnect()
      Disconnect device This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately. If disconnect successfully, following callback will be triggered:
      iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceConnectionStateChange(String mac, String deviceType, int status, int errorID)
      The status will be 2(iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_DISCONNECTED). Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
      iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
      void getActivityRemind()
      Get activity remind setting.
      void getAlarmClockDetail(int... ids)
      Get alarm information by id This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately. If get successfully, following callback will be triggered:
      iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
      The action is AmProfile.ACTION_GET_ALARMINFO_AM. The keys of the message will show in KeyList of the action. If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
      iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
      The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
      the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.

    • Method Detail

      • setUserInfo

        public void setUserInfo(int age,
                        int height,
                        float weight,
                        int gender,
                        int unit,
                        int target,
                        int activityLevel)
        Set user information
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • It will calculate and set BMR first and then set user information.
        • If set successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_SET_BMR_SUCCESS_AM and AmProfile.ACTION_SET_USERINFO_SUCCESS_AM.
          • The message will be null.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Parameters:
        age - User's age
        Range: [1, 255]
        height - User's height(int in cm)
        Range: [1, 255]
        weight - User's weight(float)
        Range: [1.0, 255.0]
        gender - User's gender
        Value:
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_FEMALE
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_MALE
        unit - Distance's unit type(kilometre or miles)
        Value:
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_UNIT_IMPERIAL_STANDARD (miles)
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_UNIT_METRIC (kilometre)
        target - The goal of maximum steps
        Range: [4, 65535(0xFFFF)]
        activityLevel - The level of activity strength
        • 1 indicates sedentary
        • 2 indicates active
        • 3 indicates very active

      • setMode

        @Deprecated
public void setMode(int mode,
                                int minute)
        Deprecated. 
        Set mode
        Parameters:
        mode - 0: sleep
        minute - minute >= 30 && minute < 30*48 && (minute%30)==0 CallbackAmProfile.ACTION_SET_DEVICE_MODE_AM

        public void syncStageReprotData()
        Get stage report data
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If get successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_SYNC_STAGE_DATA_AM.
          • The keys of the message will show in KeyList of the action.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)

      • setPicture

        public void setPicture(int index)
        Set picture for AM
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If set successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_SET_PICTURE_SUCCESS_AM.
          • The message will be null.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of picture
        • 0 indicates the frog picture.
        • 1 indicates the default picture.

        public void reset(int id)

        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If reset successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_RESET_AM.

          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Parameters:
        id - User's ID
        Range: [1, 2147483647(0x7FFFFFFF)]

      • getAlarmClockDetail

        public void getAlarmClockDetail(int... ids)
        Get alarm information by id
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If get successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_GET_ALARMINFO_AM.
          • The keys of the message will show in KeyList of the action.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Parameters:
        ids - Alarm id array to be query.
        • The parameters should be 1, 2, or 3
        • The duplicate parameters will be IGNORED
        • The query result will be in ascending order of id.
        • If specified alarm not set yet, the result will not include the id.

      • setAlarmClock

        public void setAlarmClock(int id,
                          int hour,
                          int min,
                          boolean isRepeat,
                          int[] weeks,
                          boolean isOn)
        Set/Unset alarm
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If set/unset successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_SET_ALARMINFO_SUCCESS_AM.
          • The message will be null.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Parameters:
        id - Alarm id
        Range: 1, 2 or 3
        hour - Alarm hour part
        Range: [0, 23]
        min - Alarm minute part
        Range: [0, 59]
        isRepeat - Indicates whether it will repeat:
        • true indicates that it will repeat as the weeks parameter
        • false indicates that it will only play one time and IGNORE the weeks parameter
        weeks - The days in a week to repeat the alarm, week[0~6] indicates Sun~Sat.
        And 1 indicates open, 0 indicates close.
        For example:
        {0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0} means the alarm will repeat on Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri.
        isOn - true if want to set the alarm, false to unset it.

      • deleteAlarmClock

        public void deleteAlarmClock(int id)
        Delete alarm by id
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If delete successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_DELETE_ALARM_SUCCESS_AM.
          • The message will be null.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Parameters:
        id - Alarm id(should be 1, 2 or 3)

                              boolean isOn)

          • The message will be null.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Parameters:
        hour - Activity remind hour part
        Range: [0, 23]
        min - Activity remind minute part
        Range:[0, 59]
        isOn - true if want to set activity remind, false to unset it.

      • queryAMState

        public void queryAMState()
        Get device state and battery information
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If get successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_QUERY_STATE_AM.
          • The keys of the message will show in KeyList of the action.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)

      • setUserId

        public void setUserId(int id)
        Set user ID
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If set successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_SET_USERID_SUCCESS_AM.
          • The message will be null.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Parameters:
        id - new user id
        Range: [1, 2147483647(0x7FFFFFFF)]

        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.

        Range: [1, 32767(0x7FFF)]

      • syncActivityData

        public void syncActivityData()
        Get the activity data.
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • After getting the activity data, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be ACTION_SYNC_ACTIVITY_DATA_AM
          • The keys of message will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)

      • setHourMode

        public void setHourMode(int hourMode)
        Set hour mode
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If set successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action is AmProfile.ACTION_SET_HOUR_MODE_SUCCESS_AM.
          • The message will be null.
        • If error happens, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be AmProfile.ACTION_ERROR_AM
          • The message will be a JSON string with error ID and description,
            the keys will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Parameters:
        hourMode - The value should be one of following:
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_12_HOUR_MODE
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_24_HOUR_MODE
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_EXCEPT_EUROPE_12_HOUR_MODE
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_EUROPE_12_HOUR_MODE
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_EXCEPT_EUROPE_24_HOUR_MODE
        • AmProfile.AM_SET_EUROPE_24_HOUR_MODE

      • init

        public void init()
        Specified by:
        init in interface DeviceControl

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Description copied from interface: DeviceControl
        Disconnect device
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately.
        • If disconnect successfully, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceConnectionStateChange(String mac, String deviceType, int status, int errorID)
          • The status will be 2(iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_DISCONNECTED).
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)
        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface DeviceControl

        We recommend not use this method, use iHealthDevicesUpgradeManager instead.

        UpDeviceControl's implementation
